comment: She is very sweet, but very confusing and unclear about expectations for you. I had to ask about 20questions in class to understand what she wants and then she would change her mind and deadlines. She is so, so kind, but needs to work on communication. First B I have ever received in college & I'm a senior. Take someone else if you can.

there's no dates on the syllabus and she rarely uses D2L. there was zero communication with her outside of the classroom. assignments are all in the textbook website and are super time consuming. she only tells you the due date in class. she also never pronounced my clearly hispanic name right.

She is one of the nicest Professors I have ever had at KSU, but she is really horrible with communication. She made the classroom warm and inviting, but it doesn't matter how nice you are if you do not respond to emails, answer questions clearly, do not stick to the syllabus, and are disorganized. KSU does not have a good foreign languages program.

Profesora Wood is an outstanding teacher!  She not only cares that her students learn Spanish well but also takes extra time to help her students. She fills class time with activities to understand homework. She masterfully grasps students abilities so to enhance their individual understanding. Her teaching style covers material most thoroughly.

Prof. Wood is a great instructor. She really wants you to succeed. She gives a decent amount of online homework through McGraw Hill, but it is all relevant to the exams. She lectures straight from the textbook. You must participate in class for a grade. Overall I highly suggest taking her!

Professor Wood does seem to care about her students a lot and she is a very sweet soul. That being said, she is an awful professor for an online course. I had to email her at least four times to get her to correct the due dates on her online course and open up modules that were supposed to already be open. Lovely lady, bad professor.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Test heavy

comment: took it online and was pretty easy. she is so so nice and understanding and if you email her she will help you and is willing to extend deadlines. there are kinda a lot of assignments and projects but if you put in effort it is easy to pass.

She is SO nice like she would give us extra time for a paper if we needed. However, she waited until day before to put any grades in, and she took off points for minor problems. she would put "good job" on ur paper but give u a 70. She forces participation: she will call on u and will not move on until you answer. She's sweet but don't take.

She is nice, but that is the only good thing. I am a student athlete and missed a quiz. When I asked her the next period to take it, she said she drops the lowest quiz grade so she was not going to let me take it. This goes against academic policy. She does not post assignment drop boxes until after they are due. Horrible and harsh grader

She is very sweet, but there is so much work. Attendance is mandatory and you have to present or speak fluent Spanish in class each day. She NEVER answers her emails and she never talks about homework in class but 10 assignments are due on a Tuesday at 9 am. She is a good teacher but expects you to know more at that level than you should.

Shes sweet, and she does what she can to help students. I personally mostly felt that the homework was difficult at times, and she doesnt communicate when there will be tests, quizzes, etc. Sometimes I was sick and would stay back not knowing that she had a surprise test planned for that day. Go to class & check CONNECT, however, and youre good.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Skip class? You won't pass.--Tough grader

comment: She wasn't a bad teacher but also wasn't the best. She is a very tough grader. She's very slow when it comes to replying to emails so be prepared. Other than that she's funny and will interact with you if you meet her halfway. *She give tons of homework ��*
Do NOT take her. She is TERRIBLE.

Shes a nice lady I guess but when it comes to the class I wouldnt take it. The workload is RIDICULOUS. She makes you pay $100 for a homework program just to pile on five other assignments. I am now struggling in another class because Im trying to keep up with this one. And she doesnt really care either.

I appreciated her caring attitude. She grades pretty harshly. My main issue with her class is the intense amount of workload. Like truly it's ridiculous. Every week there is on average 3-5 D2L assignments, then separate multiple Connect assignments, then oral presentations, cultural projects, cultural events, and essays. For an 1102 course too much
rating_tags: Lots of homework--So many papers--Tough grader

comment: Profesora Wood is a very kind and caring teacher, but sometimes it can be hard to keep up with the class. Sometimes lectures can be a little difficult to follow as well. The class is heavily group oriented too which was something I did not particularly enjoy. The homework was also set up strange in Connect.

Prof. Wood seems very kind and she responds quickly to emails, but taking her class in an online format was my biggest mistake this semester. Her syllabus is unclear, she doesn't tell you which assignments are due when, and she seems overall not equipped to teach online. She is very nice and a forgiving grader but the amount of homework is inhumane

Professor Wood is the most caring professor I have ever had. She truly wanted all of her students to do well in this course. She offered many different types of assignments as well as 4 tests. There are many chances in this class to do very well. Professor Wood is such a caring and helpful lady who is truly there for her students! I loved her!

If she can tell youre trying in the class, she wont let you fail. She doesnt speak a lot of English but she still does her best to talk to students in a way theyll understand. Theres always an oral part to your exam though so work on talking and always participate if you can.

As long as you participate and she can see that you're trying, you should be good. The class isn't hard but you do need to pay attention and probably study because she's not really an easy grader on her exams. She's a sweet lady who cares about student success so definitely take her if you can!

I love Señora Wood so much!! She genuinely cares for her students and will do anything to help us pass. I learned so much in her class. I would definitely recommend taking from her!! (Easy A if you put effort in)

Shes nice but she never mentions the homework or how the homework works. She will send e-mails half way through the semester saying make sure to turn this on D2L but she never mentioned it ever in class.

Professor Wood is very kind and gives decent feedback. However, she is somewhat disorganized and inconsistent. Her expectations aren't always clear. If you take her class, ask lots of questions and check the syllabus. She doesn't always tell you when assessments are coming up.

If you ever have a chance to take this teacher and/or class, DONT. She is very inconsistent. She does NOT help you. She barely knows how to speak english so she makes you speak Spanish in class. I swear there was a quiz or IPA every class period. I have made an A in every Spanish class I have ever taken and I am trying really hard just to make a B

Look, I have been able to make my way through every spanish class I have taken in my life. I'm not the best but I have made a mid to high B if not an A in every class. I have a 71 in the class and I'm in danger of failing. She expects you to be fluent in the language, doesn't explain clearly and makes the class far more difficult than it needs tobe

She expects students to be fluent in Spanish enough to be the only language spoken in class, even if this is only your third class. Her voice makes it very difficult to understand her instructions in both English and Spanish. Her tests and quizzes are very hard because there is so much material, yet questions are over few and specific things.

she's a very nice lady but an absolutely terrible teacher. she's completely disorganized and an extremely tough grader. I'm going to wind up with a low C and have worked my ass of in this class. she gives homework VERY often and theres basically a quiz or paper every single week. i highly recommend looking for another teacher.

Profesora Wood was possibly the worst teacher I've had my entire college career. I'm an A-B student with a 3.7 GPA and her summer Spanish class was the first C I've ever received. Her grading is unclear and doesn't explain why you got something wrong. She responds to emails days later and was late to class every time we had to meet.

Awful class! Took her for a hybrid over summer and during class she would only go over vocab and never teaches Grammar. Then the test is mostly grammar with no clear instructions. She never helps you. Also, the tutoring lab even said she is making this 10x harder than it should be. The homework is difficult on grammar.

I honestly really enjoy Professor Wood. I have taken her for two semesters now and plan on taking her in the future. Sometimes I get frustrated when she only speaks in Spanish but if you ask she will clarify in English. She is a reasonable lady and really cares for her student's wellbeing. If you go to class, you will do fine.
Professor Woods is a nice lady, but she gives lots of homework. There was a quiz every single week. She hardly ever answered her email, so do not expect a timely response.

Honestly, this class was not that bad. A lot of homework, but it helps your grade. Sometimes, it was a bit irritating because she would miss appointments but overall she was a nice lady and the class was a nice environment.
Worst teacher I've ever had. I am a Spanish major and had to teach myself everything this course covered. Lots of homework and it was usually stuff we hadn't learnt yet. Do not take her.
This professor...does not teach. She just uses websam. However, the content is easy, even for a beginning class. She truly does speak 90% in spanish though.
She is a very nice lady. Lots of homework on Websam, but she goes over all the material in class before it is due. Her tests and quizes are very easy. Attendance is required.

Honestly,the worst teacher ive ever had. Ive had 4 years of spanish and i struggled in this class.she never tells you when things are due. At the end of the semester, told us to do extra credit if our grade was close to the next letter grade (which mine was a 78.4) and i did all of it and she still gave me a C. take someone else!

Lots of busy work. Homeworks due on WEBSAM which is harshly graded and unforgiving. Tests are easy and compositions aren't bad. Professor not always clear but I felt like being in a highschool class, always some kind of busy work due. Not a horrible class, just recommending a different professor.

I hope that my higher level Spanish professors will be less harsh on grading as Professor Wood is.  Also, she is not clear on instructions and does not use vista to post grades at all.  I had no idea what my grade was until the other day when she emailed me a progress report.  It's like being in high school again with all the silly games we played

DIFFICULT for an intro class. Her directions are not clear at all, and there is  ton of online homework. Her tests are difficult and focus almost completely on culture as oppose to grammar and vocabulary. Studying a lot is a MUST. Tons of homework, Weekly quizzes, 3 written compositions, 3 tests, and a culture project.

Good professor, you will have to be very interactive in the class because she calls on everyone to make sentences. one project very simple, her tests are really hard and expect to study tons if trying to make a good grade - not an easy A. very very strict grader for a beginning class.  tons of hw online.
Mrs. Wood is very nice but this was a very difficult class.  She is a very strict grader, especially for an entry level class.  Be prepared to work very hard for your grade.

Very nice and friendly. Annoying voice but it's bearable. Quizzes every other week but they're short and sweet. She grades papers rather quickly, I was surprised. Lots of oral assignments and working with partners. There are 3 compositions, 2 tests, and a group project. I would take her again.

Do NOT take this professor! She never answers emails, she's never in her office. She doesn't grade anything on time and she misgraded EVERY exam! She was late to our final & had to reschedule the oral portion of the final for half the class. Most annoying voice ever! Unclear about assignment expectations and due dates. Seriously take someone else!

Very hard professor but if you are interested in learning the language take her. She will not give you the grade you must earn it. I busted my tail in her class. I left knowing spanish better than I did before. She is a nice lady and she grades hard. Overall good class.
Very Sweet lady who is probably to nice.

Profesora Wood is an incredibly nice woman. She goes out of her way to make sure students understand the material and is almost always willing to work with you until you are ready to move on. However, this is her first semester teaching this class and she can be a bit unclear about expectations. VERY heavy work load, but very educational!Recommend!

Ask her if you can bring her your composition a week before it's due so that you can have some corrections done before she grades it. DO THE ONLINE HOMEWORK. Tests-you can study your butt off and you'll still get points taken off in the culture section, so just do the best you can. She is not easy, but she'll work with you if you don't act helpless

I agree, her assignments MAY/MAY NOT be due! That's no joke! She also gave  zeros when we didn't turn in an e-mail assignment for speeches (b/c she originally told us they were outlines!) Seriously, if she was great last semester then something happened because I wasn't expect this class to be easy but it wasn't even decent to standards!!!

Guys something happened this semester, because Professor Wood just got extremely hard. Class average is a C-, and she isn't going to help us pass this go around. All our grades were given with unrealistic standards, and our compositions were ripped apart. Hopefully next semester I'll get someone else...
Very sweet & understanding, experienced, good at explaining material.  Tests and quizzes are pretty easy, but she takes off half points for minor error.  Overall a pretty easy class.
Mrs. Wood is a very good spanish professor- always willing to help. I have taken her 3 times!

P. Wood has the most annoying voice ever and she conducts all her classes in Spanish. She hates to give directions in English and she gesture with her hands in Spanish if you don't understand something. Oh and she loves to play chilidish games like those you would play in middle school or high school. Easy B if you semi-try

She's a nice lady and the class is pretty easy, but she's not very responsive or organized. She also likes to play games EVERY day which are annoying but they can help you remember the material. There are several tests, several quizzes, 3 compositions, and participation is required.

Professora Wood is super nice. The games she plays EVERY CLASS can be annoying, but they really made the material stick. She goes over everything so much that it's difficult to not to well on the tests. There was one presentation, 3 tests (plus the final), weekly quizzes and homework.

I did get an A in her class, but she is not very organized, does not return emails or phone calls, you have to assume alot in her class and take alot of your own initiative to study each chapter in the book, she does not tell you what to do, she assumes you know!
Best teacher for this class.  I would definitely recommend her.  Willing to help.

you have to do alot of busy work and she plays stupid games EVERY class. She was 30 mins late for our final and did not turn my classes grades in on time and so we ALL got incompletes. Then she would never return our emails to fix the problem. Do not take her if you work or have a life outside of school.

Profesora Wood is very nice and helpful. I recommend taking her for as many Spanish classes as you can. Yeah, sometimes I'm really not up to playing the games she does early in the morning, but they really do make the information stick. She's a great Spanish professor.
I had her Spring '05.  She was ok.  She does help you, if you need it.  I just didn't like all of those stupid games.  She is nice and always smiling.  Come to class or you will be sorry.

She is awesome!  We finish a chapter in about a week and we have reviews right before tests or quizzes.  She is very nice and very helpful.  She likes to play games to test your knowledge but if you did your homework you will be ok.  Do your homework!!  She listens to you and helps you until you get it.
